intro: Limnanthemum gunnii, commonly known as the golden star or rock melon, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Limnanthemum gunnii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
